page.title: 17The Parish Council
page.content: Barnburgh Parish Council was formed in 1894 and took its present constitution and powers under the Local Government Act 1972. The Parish Council is the most local and accessible form of government and very much the organ of local opinion.Our Parish includes about 720 dwellings and over 2000 inhabitants in the villages of Barnburgh,Harlington and Melton Mill Lane. There are 7 Parish Councillors and elections are held every 4 years. The Council deals with such matters as planning, highways, public footpaths, tree planting, public seating and the general appearance of all parts of the village. The Parish Council has three part-time enployees - the clerk, the greenkeeper and the handyman.
